channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @muckrakery @haymarketbooks @Microcosmmm might also be interested. And they move very fast.
Good news for Florida get refusers, as the OU’s favorite Florida politician blocks the OU’s favorite agunah pressure tactic! https://t.co/Tp4WhhWiC5
Rereading Steve Erickson as dystopia approaches. https://t.co/xpDCpxQWpQ
@joshtpm I think this qualifies as an Avenue Q reference.
@nycsouthpaw Charming indeed. I’d like to believe that my predecessor as editor of our college paper would have issued rulings like this had his nomination for a federal judgeship gone through.
@trekonomics All I ask is they deliver on the show trials they have promised for the would-be Vichy Democrats.

A thoughtful examination of America’s history of racial oppression is apparently heresy for this college, which has chosen to adopt White Christian Nationalism as its religious dogma. https://t.co/PpNWU5MKIa
Your occasional reminder that conservative religions are premised on the denial of history and free inquiry. They long for the good old days full of worship, respect for their authority, and the needless death of childbearing women because their “omnipotent” deity forgot
to include instructions on hand-washing in Leviticus.

@AkivaMCohen I still say we litigate IG in Texas and allege that my six post Jewish publishing account was taken down on grounds of antisemitism. The refusal to explain infringements and allow for appeal can only give rise to conspiracy theories.
Caption contest. Go! https://t.co/AfhRrbj2GK
@joshtpm Hard to see Democrats as fighters if they’re not willing to drop the unanimous threshold a few points with a rules change. This is Italian level of dysfunction.

Why read this book now when it will be even more relevant after the next White terror attack? https://t.co/F5WDaHiJJN
Incidentally: The @audible_com version of this book is great.
@johnpavlovitz We have a “Republicans believe guns are the solution” problem. The question is what is the problem they hope to solve by arming our civilian teens with military weapons.
@lonny_goldsmith @AirInBerc @JDShapiro @LosFelizDaycare Please be sure to syndicate with @JTAnews if you can verify. Definitely a story of global import.
Big if true. https://t.co/nx5vKozHp3

America has no gun problem. America has guns because the dominant Republican Party sees an America flooded with AR-15s as a solution. The only question is what problems is the Republican Party trying to solve by giving AR-15s to civilian teens. https://t.co/IKAcKb2eIn
@dzkalman There is no gun problem. Guns are the chosen solution of the dominant Republican Party. The question is what is the problem to which Republican-approved AR-15s are the solution.
@NathanJRobinson British billionaire with Chinese ties Rupert Murdoch approves his message.
The Platonic refutation of the ontological argument for the existence of God. https://t.co/CuJRUCqXTF
Lawless Alito court rules unelected bureaucrats are above the law. https://t.co/j98X3KI4Cy
Crooked federalist judges help crooked politicians https://t.co/b2keAVYaDA
@bernstein_judah I’d be pressing the NYPD and FBI to be investigating this question while they’re holding suspects.
@bernstein_judah Key question: Are these attacks motivated by conspiracy theories as were the murders in Monsey and Jersey City?

@schraubd @ZacharyBraiterm So they agree with AIPAC that the question of the 10 million or so people living in Mandatory Palestine is more important than are the well-being of hundreds of millions of Americans.
@jh_swanson To be fair, Paramount has allowed the writers to take it where NBC would not have.

@trekonomics Kinda natural to hate your job and its subject matter after a few decades.
@trekonomics Anyway, did you know that if the moon was made of green cheese lunar mining could displace the methane emissions of dairy cows equivalent to two million cars driving two million miles for two million years?
